prompt: Please write out the expression of the formula in the image using LaTeX format.
text:
The expression in the image is a part of a mathematical formula that involves a combination of arithmetic operations and a square root. It can be written in LaTeX format as follows:

$$
\begin{aligned}
\frac{3}{2} - \sqrt{\frac{25}{4}} & = \frac{1}{2} \sqrt{\frac{25}{4}} \\
& = \frac{1}{2} \times \sqrt{5} \times \sqrt{4} \\
& = \frac{1}{2} \times \sqrt{20} \\
& = \frac{1}{2} \times 2 \sqrt{5} \\
& = 1 \sqrt{5}
\end{aligned}
$$

This expression demonstrates the process of simplifying a fraction by finding the square root of the denominator, which in this case is $\sqrt{25}$.

Please write out the expression of the formula in the image using LaTeX format.
text:
The expression in the image is a part of a polynomial equation, which can be written in LaTeX format as follows:

$$
\begin{aligned}
& x^4 + 4 x^3 + 12 x^2 - 16 x - 12 = 0 \\
& x^4 + 4 x^3 - 16 x^2 - 16 x - 12 = 0 \\
& (x^2 + 2 x - 4)(x^2 - 4 x + 4) = 0 \\
& x^2 + 2 x - 4 = 0 \\
& x^2 - 4 x + 4 = 0 \\
& x = 0 \\
& x = \pm \sqrt{4}
\end{aligned}
$$

This expression represents the solutions to the polynomial equation, which include the x-values where the polynomial is equal to zero.
